title: Bot detection in this game is SH*T!!!
body: The worst part is Riot doesn't do anything to fight against botting.

replies.body: Yes they do, they ban them in waves rather than individually. Unfortunately this means you'll run into them in between, but it makes it harder for the bot makers to adapt to the ban. Not an ideal solution but don't know if there is one.

> [{quoted}](name=Aneirin,realm=OCE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=WevWNsTt,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-08-06T21:19:35.306+0000)
>
> Yes they do, they ban them in waves rather than individually. Unfortunately this means you'll run into them in between, but it makes it harder for the bot makers to adapt to the ban. Not an ideal solution but don't know if there is one.

Ban them after the first game. Then the people selling them cant sell the banned accounts. It is not a hard thing to do.

Banning in waves every now and then still allows the people selling the accounts to sell them before they are banned.

If they banned them immediately that would make it trivial to test what Riot is detecting and change your program accordingly. This would mean that Riot would also have to change their program daily which would mean there would be a lot more false punishments, especially considering they wouldn't have much time to test their changes.

Your suggestion changes us from a less than ideal system to a completely ineffective or harmful one.

> [{quoted}](name=RoG Seraph,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=WevWNsTt,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2018-08-06T21:25:23.480+0000)
>
> Ban them after the first game. Then the people selling them cant sell the banned accounts. It is not a hard thing to do.
> 
> Banning in waves every now and then still allows the people selling the accounts to sell them before they are banned.

Then they get an update everytime their bots get banned, on how they were detected. Then the botmakers tweak things a bit, and send out a new wave of bots. They get banned again right away, botmakers go okay that didn't work, maybe I'll try this. Now they got it right. Riot can't detect that bot for a while until they come up with new ways to detect them. Now they're stuck in an eternal dance of getting caught, tweaking systems, putting out new bots.  It's thousands of people seeking easy profit versus one company. You need to look at it realistically. Chances are, you actually know nothing about how bots work and how they're detected, but you don't look at the world realistically and you want every problem fixed for you. That's fine. But much like real life, there isn't always a fix.

What Riot does, is tracks the sites that sell these botted accounts. It's like a drug sting. They will let them go until they lock em down and find an opportunity to get legal on em. They sue them. They shut down entire operations. Not just individual accounts.  But please, tell the multimillion dollar company how to handle these matters. Please help them.

Well, Riot does try. But I agree, it's not nearly as good as it should be.
It's actually been the best it's been in quite a few months.  It was really really bad this time last year.
